725326f-a.title: Queens: 40th Road - Main Street
725326f-a.text:
40th Road, west from the N.W. corner of Main Street, showing
thereon the John Titus Van de Water grocery store from 1865 to 1874,
when Donley Brothers purchased it. They operated until 1877, then
being financially embarassed, Divine Hewlett Van de Water took it over
(1883). A Van de water still owned it in 1897.
1922.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.
MAY BE REPRODUCED.

727332f-b.title: Queens: Main Street - 40th Road
727332f-b.text:
Main Street, east side, north from 40th Road, showing
Flushing's main business street. Fairchild's Flushing
Institute stood here in 1873 and 1891.
View 2 is north from Roosevelt Avenue.
P. L. Sperr  August 21, 1935
NO REPRODUCTIONS  Views 1,2

725318f-a.text:
Fortieth Avenue, north side, between Main Street and
Union Street, showing the N.G.N.Y. Armory od the Sep. Gompany
which was organized in 1876. This Armory was erected in 1894.

727331f-a.title: Queens: Main Street - 40th Road
727331f-a.text:
Main Street (tracks thereon), at the S.W. corner of 40th Road,
showing the former Halleran house (No. 113 Main Street, a hotel).
J. J. Halleran, 1873; and JJohn JJ. Halleran and Sons, 1898, were the
owners. This building has been stuccoed and altered into stores.
1922.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.
MAY BE REPRODUCED.

725317f-d.title: Queens: 40th Avenue - Main Street
725317f-d.text:
Fortieth Ave., south side, between Main and Union Sts., showing
in 4 views a private school discontinued in 1902 and in the process
of demolishment in Feb. 1925. This structure, erected in 1827, was
incorporated in April of that year. Actual school instructions be-
gan in 1828 under the supervision of theRev. William Augustus
Muhlenberg D.D. A female school known as St. Ann's Hall, was opened
by John F. Schroeder D.D. and oprated as such from 1839 to 1846.
Ezra Fairfield removed his Greenbrook School from Morristown N.J.
to the Flushing Pavilion in Nay 1845 and remained for about a year
until the removal of Dr. Schroeders' school when he moved in.. From
this point this structure became known as the Flushing lInstitute.
Ezra Fairchild was principal in 1845. He was subsequently succeeded
by his son Elias.
Jan 1923.
Views 1, 2, 3 and 4.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection
MAY BE REPRODUCED.

40th Road, north side, just west of Main Street, showing
the fire house of Hook and Ladder 129. It is opposite the
